skill.name: copy-editing
skill.description: When the user wants to edit, review, or improve existing marketing copy. Also use when the user mentions 'edit this copy,' 'review my copy,' 'copy feedback,' 'proofread,' 'polish this,' 'make this better,' or 'copy sweep.' This skill provides a systematic approach to editing marketing copy through multiple focused passes.
skill.summary: Expert copy editing for marketing copy using the Seven Sweeps Framework for systematic improvement.
skill.author: coreyhaines31

Evaluation confirms these are false positives—all detections are marketing copy editing terms like 'desire', 'lead', 'missing', and 'action' in plain text documentation. This is a read-only text processing skill with no executable code, network access, or cryptographic functionality. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Improve Marketing Copy with Seven Sweeps
content.value_statement: Marketing copy often fails to convert due to unclear messaging, weak claims, and lack of emotional impact. This skill provides a systematic Seven Sweeps Framework to edit marketing copy through focused passes, ensuring clarity, consistency, and persuasive power while preserving the original voice.
actual_capabilities: Edit marketing copy through seven focused passes (Clarity, Voice, So What, Prove It, Specificity, Emotion, Risk)
Identify and eliminate weak language like filler words, jargon, and vague claims
Ensure every claim has supporting evidence and benefits connect to reader desires
Transform flat copy into emotionally resonant messaging that drives action
Apply quick-pass editing for faster reviews when full sweeps are not needed
Provide specific edit recommendations with clear rationale for each change
limitations: Does not write new copy from scratch (use copywriting skill for new content)
Does not test or validate copy effectiveness through A/B testing
Does not provide legal or compliance review of marketing claims
Relies on user to provide context about audience, goals, and brand voice

use_cases.title: Marketing Team Copy Review
use_cases.description: Systematically review landing page copy, email campaigns, or ad text to identify gaps in clarity, missing proof, and weak emotional triggers that may be costing conversions.

use_cases.title: Content Creator Polishing
use_cases.description: Transform rough draft blog posts or social media content into polished, compelling copy that maintains the author's voice while improving clarity and impact.

use_cases.title: Agency Quality Assurance
use_cases.description: Run a standardized copy sweep on client deliverables to ensure all marketing materials meet quality standards before publication or campaign launch.
use_cases.target_user: Agency account managers and QA specialists

prompt_templates.title: Quick Copy Polish
prompt_templates.prompt: Polish this marketing copy using the Seven Sweeps Framework. Focus on: clarity (one idea per sentence), voice consistency, connecting features to benefits with 'so what' bridges, adding specific proof points, replacing vague language with concrete details, heightening emotional impact, and reducing risk near CTAs. Keep the original voice intact. Copy: [PASTE COPY HERE]
prompt_templates.scenario: When user provides copy for quick improvement

prompt_templates.title: Full Editing Sweep
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete Seven Sweeps edit on this marketing copy. For each sweep: 1) Clarity - mark confusing parts and recommend fixes. 2) Voice - note tone shifts and suggest smoothing edits. 3) So What - identify claims missing benefit bridges. 4) Prove It - flag unsupported assertions and suggest proof. 5) Specificity - upgrade vague words to concrete details. 6) Emotion - add emotional texture where flat. 7) Zero Risk - address objections near CTAs. Present findings by sweep with specific edit recommendations. Copy: [PASTE COPY HERE]
prompt_templates.scenario: When user wants comprehensive review with detailed feedback

prompt_templates.title: Before and After Revision
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit this marketing copy and provide both a tracked version showing all changes and a clean final version. For each edit, include a brief note explaining why the change improves the copy. Focus on eliminating weak words, strengthening claims, and increasing specificity. Copy: [PASTE COPY HERE]
prompt_templates.scenario: When user needs to see exactly what changed and why

prompt_templates.title: Targeted Problem Fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix this copy focusing specifically on [SPECIFIC ISSUE - e.g., lack of proof, unclear message, weak CTAs, flat emotion, inconsistent tone]. Explain the problem first, then provide the edited version with the issue resolved while ensuring other elements remain intact. Copy: [PASTE COPY HERE]
prompt_templates.scenario: When user knows what specific problem to address

best_practices: Always run sweeps sequentially and loop back after each sweep to verify earlier fixes are still intact.
Preserve the original author's voice and core message—edits should enhance, not replace.
Provide specific edit recommendations with clear rationale rather than vague suggestions.
anti_patterns: Trying to fix everything in one pass—spread edits across multiple focused sweeps for better results.
Changing the core message or brand personality to match personal writing preferences.
Making edits without evidence or proof to back up stronger claims being added.

faq.question: What is the Seven Sweeps Framework?
faq.answer: The Seven Sweeps Framework is a systematic copy editing process that reviews marketing copy through seven focused passes: Clarity, Voice and Tone, So What, Prove It, Specificity, Heightened Emotion, and Zero Risk. Each pass catches specific issues that get missed when trying to edit everything at once.

faq.question: How long does a full copy sweep take?
faq.answer: A full seven-sweep review typically takes 10-20 minutes depending on copy length. Use the quick-pass checks for faster reviews when a full sweep is not needed.

faq.question: Should I use this skill for new copy or just existing copy?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for editing existing copy. For writing new marketing copy from scratch, use the copywriting skill first, then apply copy-editing to polish the draft.

faq.question: Does this skill change my brand voice?
faq.answer: No. The skill preserves the original brand voice and personality. Edits focus on clarity, impact, and effectiveness—not imposing a different writing style.

faq.question: What information should I provide before running a copy sweep?
faq.answer: Provide the copy goal (awareness, conversion, retention), target audience, desired reader action, brand voice guidelines, and any available proof or testimonials to support claims.

faq.question: How does this skill differ from proofreading?
faq.answer: Copy editing goes far beyond proofreading. It evaluates strategy, messaging effectiveness, emotional resonance, and persuasive power—not just grammar, spelling, and typos.
